intro: Cogylia biternata, commonly known as the three-leaved sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Cogylia biternata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
